abstract: Most recent iPods have a volume-limit control on the settings menu that can be used to lower the maximum volume to a more ear-friendly level.
snippet: Most recent iPods have a volume-limit control on the settings menu that can be used to lower the maximum volume to a more ear-friendly level.
lead_paragraph: Blasting music too loud for too long through an iPod’s headphones could lead to damaged ears or hearing loss years down the road. Most recent iPods have a volume-limit control on the settings menu that can be used to lower the maximum volume to a more ear-friendly level.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Limiting the Volume on Your iPod
